info.title: RESTful WebAPI for MT4/MT5
info.description: It uses native MetaQuote ManagerAPI for both MT4 and MT5 connection.

get.description: Few sensitive fields will be suppressed from output

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To date/time. Default: ```mgr.ServerTime()``` will be used.

404.description: Order not found in the list of opened

get.summary: Open trades by login and group

parameters.description: List of logins to be requested from server. If none specified - BadRequest will be returned

404.description: Account does not have any open orders, so it assumed that margin is zero

get.description: Request margin level from MT4 server

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The name of the symbol the data is requested for

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The name of the symbol the data is requested for

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The time-frame the data is requested for

get.summary: Configuration of the current manager account

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: One or more symbols separated by commas. Specify the full name of the symbol, including the path. For example, Forex\EURUSD. The symbol name can be obtained by using the IMTConSymbol::Symbol method. Symbols can also be specified using wildcard characters: "*" (any value) and "!" (exclude). For example, Forex\*,!Forex\EURUSD  all symbols in the Forex subgroup except EURUSD.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The name of the group whose symbol settings should be used (IMTConGroupSymbol). The method will pass symbol configurations based on how they are redefined for the specified group. If the parameter is null, the method will pass the basic symbol settings.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: One or more groups separated by commas. Specify the full name of the group, including the path. For example, demo\demoforex. The group name can be obtained using the IMTConGroup::Group method. Groups can also be specified using wildcard characters: "*" (any value) and "!" (exclude). For example: "demo*,!demoforex"  all groups whose names begin with 'demo', except for the group demoforex.

post.description: Send trade request on behalf of dealer. Only dealer actions (200-255) can be set as a request type in Action (Dealer* etc).

get.summary: Open orders by the list of tickets (pumping)
Open orders by the list of logins (pumping)
Deals by the list of tickets
Deals by the list of logins

get.description:
Get an array of open positions of all symbols for the specified login.
To get a position when using the hedging accounting system (EnMarginMode::MARGIN_MODE_RETAIL_HEDGED), use the IMTManagerAPI::PositionGetByTicket method as a position in that case is identified by the ticket, not by the login and symbol.

post.description:
In case no login is specified for a record (is equal to 0), the server will automatically allocate a login from the available range and will assign it to the user record. In case there are no more available ranges of logins, the MT_RET_USR_LOGIN_EXHAUSTED error is returned.

The following parameters must be filled in the user record you are adding: IMTUser::Group and IMTUser::Leverage, as well as IMTUser::FirstName or IMTUser::LastName.

When calling the method, a check is made whether the entry already exists.If the account already exists, the MT_RET_USR_LOGIN_EXIST error is returned.A key field for comparison is the user login IMTUser::Login().

A user can be added on a trade server only from the applications that run in the same trade server.For all other applications the response code MT_RET_USR_LOGIN_PROHIBITED will be returned.

Before adding, the correctness of the record is checked. If the record is incorrect, the error code MT_RET_ERR_PARAMS is returned.

If any of passwords (Password and PasswordInvestor) is null or empty, both of them will be generated. We will generate passwords and call manager api method to create user. If MT5 does not like our password, we will try again with new pair, maximum of 10 times, then stop with error.

get.summary: Accounts by the list of logins (pumping)

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: Groups for which accounts are requested. You can specify one group, several groups (comma separated) or a group mask. The mask is specified using characters "*" (any value) and "!" (exception). For example: "demo*,!demoforex" - all groups with the names beginning with 'demo', except for the group demoforex

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of password to be checked

requestBody.description: Value of password to be checked

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of password to be changed

requestBody.description: Value of password to be changed

post.description: Add a client to the server database

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: The name of the symbol the data is requested for

get.description: try to connect and call Ping using Manager API

timeZoneReal.description: time zone with day light mode

endHour.description: end of day time-hour and minute

endMinute.description: end of day time-hour and minute

overnightPrevTime.description: time of  next to last overnight

ConCommonShort.description: Shorter and less sensitive version of ConCommon structure, ip address, disk paths, etc removed from this structure

type.description: if none specified - it will be Balance operation. Buy/Sell actions here - pointless.

errorCode.description:
If ErrorType is MT4API, it contains MT4 ManagerAPI response code.
If ErrorType is MT5API, it contains MT5 ManagerAPI response code.

errorDescription.description:
If ErrorType is MT4API, it contains MT4 ManagerAPI response code description.
If ErrorType is MT5API, it contains MT5 ManagerAPI response code description.

login.description: Get and set the login of the client, to whom the trading account belongs.

currencyDigits.description: Get and set the number of decimal places in the account deposit currency.

balance.description: Get and set the balance of a trading account.

credit.description: Get and set the current amount of credit given to an account.

margin.description: Get and set the current value of the account margin.

marginFree.description: Get and set the free margin of an account.

marginLevel.description: Get and set the margin level as a percentage.

marginLeverage.description: Get and set the margin leverage.

profit.description: Get and set the size of the current profit for all open positions.

storage.description: Get and set the current size of swaps charged for open positions on the account.

floating.description: Get and set the size of floating profit/loss of open positions on the account.

soActivation.description: Get and set the account status as per the minimum amount of funds on the account required to maintain trading positions.

soTime.description: Get and set the time when the Margin Call or Stop Out level was reached.

soLevel.description: Get and set the margin level of an account at the time of reaching the Stop Out level.

soEquity.description: Get and set the account equity at the time of reaching the Stop Out level.

soMargin.description: Get and set the margin amount on an account at the time of reaching the Stop Out level.

blockedCommission.description: Get and set the amount of the standard commission locked on the account, which has been accumulated during the day/month.

blockedProfit.description: Get and set the amount of intraday profit locked on the account.

marginInitial.description: Get and set the current size of the initial margin of positions on a trading account.

marginMaintenance.description: Get and set the current size of the maintenance margin of positions on a trading account.

assets.description: Get and set the current total amount of assets on a trading account.

liabilities.description: Get and set the current total amount of liabilities on a trading account.

open.description: Bar open price  price at the beginning of bar formation (beginning of a minute).

high.description: The highest price inside the bar.

low.description: The lowest price inside the bar.

close.description: Bar close price  price at the end of bar formation (end of the minute)

tickVolume.description: Tick volume  number of ticks received during bar formation. The variable only counts the ticks that change the price based on which the bar is constructed (Bid or Last, depending on symbol settings). Several ticks in a row with the same price will be counted as one.

spread.description: The lowest symbol spread recorded during the bar formation time.

volume.description: The real volume of trades executed during bar formation.

tiers.description: commission tiers. Index in array from 0 means Position of the range.

companyCatalog.description: company catalog name (for reports and email templates)

newsLang.description: allowed news languages (Windows API LANGID used)

tradeInterestRate.description: interest rate for free deposit money

demoInactivityPeriod.description: demo groups in days, orders and positions will be deleted after this period

login.description: Get and set the login of a manager

mailbox.description: Get and set the name of a manager's mailbox in the internal mail system.

server.description: Get and set the ID of the trade server, to which the manager belongs.

limitLogs.description: Get and set the time period of system logs available to a manager.

limitReports.description: Get and set the time period of reports available to a manager.

right.description:
What is granted to manager.
Features not enlisted here means that such features is not permitted.

timeZone.description:
Get the time zone of a server
The time zone of a server in minutes from GMT.

Examples: 0 = GMT; -60 = GMT - 1; 60 = GMT + 1.

timeServer.description:
Get the address of the current time synchronization server
Supports time synchronization through the TIME and NTP protocols.
The maximum length of the address is 128 characters (including the sign of the string end). If a string of a greater length is assigned, it will be cut to this length

daylight.description: Get the mode of switching to the daylight saving time

daylightState.description: Get data on the presence of the daylight saving time in the platform time zone

login.description: Gets the login of the client, to whom the trade position belongs

externalId.description: The ticket of a position in an external trading system

quotesTimeout.description: The time to wait for quotes in seconds, after which trading is automatically disabled for the symbol.

marginLong.description: long orders and positions margin rate

marginShort.description: short orders and positions margin rate

marginLimit.description: limit orders and positions margin rate

marginStop.description: stop orders and positions margin rate

marginStopLimit.description: stop-limit orders and positions margin rate

timeExpiration.description: The date of trading expiration for a symbol.

sessionQuote.description: Update a quoting session of a symbol by the day and index. The day is specified by a value 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

reTimeout.description: Time in seconds during which the price issued by a dealer in the request execution mode is valid.

ieTimeout.description: Get and set the maximum allowed difference between the time of arrival of the price, at which the client places an order, and the time of the last price.

spliceTimeDays.description: The splicing shift as a number of days to the past from the symbol's expiration date IMTConSymbol::TimeExpiration

ieFlags.description: instant execution flags with extended accuracy

volumeLimitExt.description: cumulative positions and orders limit with extended accuracy

ieVolumeMaxExt.description: instant execution max volume with extended accuracy

open.description: The session opening time in minutes from 00:00. For example, 100 denotes 01:40.

openHours.description: Get the number of hours in the opening time of trading or quoting session of a symbol.

openMinutes.description: The number of minutes in the opening time of trading or quoting session of a symbol.

close.description: The session closing time in minutes from 00:00. For example, 100 denotes 01:40.

closeHours.description: The number of hours in the closing time of trading or quoting session of a symbol.

closeMinutes.description: The number of minutes in the closing time of trading or quoting session of a symbol.

password.description: [optional] Custom Password, or it will be generated

passwordInvestor.description: [optional] Custom Investor's password, or it will be generated

volume.description: it stores 100 times more volue than it is, for example value of 15 means 10/100=0.15 lots

magic.description: special value used by client experts

gatewayOrder.description: trade order ticket on master server in STP

gatewayOpenPrice.description: gateway order price deviation (pips) from order open price

gatewayClosePrice.description: gateway order price deviation (pips) from order close price

marginRate.description: margin convertation rate (rate of convertation from margin currency to deposit one)

tradeCommand.description: trade command (buy, sell, pending, balance, etc)

convRates.description:
conversation rates from profit currency to group deposit currency
(first element-for open time, second element-for close time)

updateType.description: add - order opened, delete - order closed, Update - IF login==0 THEN order deleted ELSE order updated

password.description: Password in plain-text, available only once when you create user

passwordInvestor.description: read-only mode password. In plain-text available only once when you create user

userColor.description: color got to client (used by MT Manager)

unused.description: for future use, byte[40] via Base64

apiData.description: for API usage, byte[16] via Base64

Bearer.description:
JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme. 

Enter 'Bearer' [space] and then your token in the text input below.

Example: "Bearer 12345abcdef"
Bearer.name: Authorization

tags.name: MT4ManagerAPI
tags.description:
Methods to work with MT4 using Manager API
(pumping) - means that data will be fetched from local cache, which is up to date using pumping connection to the server.
(admin) - means that your account needs to have "Administrator" checkbox ticked to use those functions
Otherwise, standard connection will be used.
Keep in mind, MT4 uses UNIX time, so time boundaries it supports: [01.01.1970 .. 19.01.2038). Shall not send bizarre values.

tags.name: MT5ManagerAPI
tags.description:
Methods to work with MT5 using Manager API
(pumping) - means that data will be fetched from local cache, which is up to date using pumping connection to the server.
(admin) - means that your account needs to have "Administrator" checkbox ticked to use those functions
Otherwise, standard connection will be used.
Keep in mind, most of the time MT5 uses UNIX time, so time boundaries it supports: [01.01.1970 .. 19.01.2038). Shall not send bizarre values. Sometimes it uses DateTime with milliseconds. Sometimes FILETIME.
